properties.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 14 at 2:17AM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM THIS
AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS...LOW HUMIDITIES AND DRY UNSTABLE
AIRMASS...

.Vigorous westerly flow aloft combined with surface low pressure
over southeast Colorado will result in gusty southwest winds this
afternoon over northeast New Mexico. Temperatures about 10 to 18
degrees above normal will allow minimum humidities to fall to 10
to 15 percent in conjunction with moderate to high Haines values.

The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag
Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 5 PM MST this
afternoon.

* AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains. Critical conditions to
develop by midday then persist until around sunset before
diminishing.

* 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40
mph.

* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent.

* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
Outdoor burning is not recommended.
properties.instruction:
Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the
field of this Red Flag Warning.

NWSheadline: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
